data.title: Wilfrid Laurier University – Toronto Campus
data.meta_description: The Wilfrid Laurier University Lazaridis School of Business & Economics has about 158 full-time faculty, 60 part-time faculty, and 49 full-time staff.
data.text:
History of Wilfrid Laurier University Lazaridis School

Wilfrid Laurier University opened its doors to students in 1911, then called the Waterloo Lutheran Seminary of Canada. Over the years, it has transformed into Laurier University.

The AACSB accredited Lazaridis School of Business & Economics was established in 1966. Today, it is one of the largest business schools in Canada.

Laurier offers full-time and part-time Ph.D., MBA, Master’s, Economics, BBA, Bachelor’s, and diploma programs. The Lazaridis School also has a second, part-time MBA campus located in Vantage Venues in the core of downtown Toronto where they offer a part-time weekend MBA and executive-format Master of Finance programs.

Location(s)

The Lazaridis School of Business & Economics’ main campus is located in Kitchener-Waterloo, Ontario, Canada, located about 62 miles west of Toronto.

Laurier currently maintains a second part-time MBA campus in Toronto, Ontario in Vantage Venues. Vantage Venues is located on the 27th floor of the Sun Life Financial Tower. Here, Students can pursue a part-time MBA or executive-format Master of Finance programs. The Toronto campus has quick access to the PATH subway system. Similarly, the two towers of the Sun Life Centre share an underground connection to St. Andrew Station.

Facilities at the Wilfrid Laurier University Lazaridis School of Business

Since 1999, Laurier’s Toronto MBA campus has been located in Vantage Venues in the Sun Life Financial Tower. The Lazaridis School occupies the 27th floor. Vantage Venues offers students a corporate learning environment for their studies in a location convenient to students already working in downtown Toronto. In addition, Vantage Venues has a number of meeting rooms, management suites, boardrooms, and break-out rooms. The Toronto campus is located about an hour away from Laurier’s Waterloo main campus.

Faculty

The Wilfrid Laurier University Lazaridis School of Business & Economics has about 158 full-time faculty members. Similarly, it has 60 part-time faculty and 49 full-time staff members.

Student Body at Wilfrid Laurier University

Laurier enrolls around 80-100 students per year in the Toronto program, with about 6,000 students currently enrolled. After that, those students are broken down into two classes of 40-50 in each. Currently, as many as 50 percent of the students are female.

MBA and MS Degree Offerings

The Wilfrid Laurier University Lazaridis School of Business & Economics in Toronto, in conclusion, offers a suite of MBA programs. For instance, students can choose to enroll in Master’s in Business Analytics, Master of Finance, Master in Management, or Masters in Management Analytics. The job placement rate for Business Administration and Economics graduates, specifically, is 97%.
